title: Freezes and I have to leave the app to restart it
text: Usually when I try to repost content from instagram to threads it‚Äôll freeze. Which is weird cause they‚Äôre too if the same app but it‚Äôs still fresh so I understand but hope this get solved soon. The link between IG and Threads is what makes thread more valuable then Twitter

title: great idea but needs some work
text:
i am so excited to continue using this app!! however, it definitely needs a couple more updates. the home page needs to include people i follow, or better yet, some type of algorithm similar to tiktok. i hate scrolling forever just seeing random verified pages i have no interest in. i want ro see posts from my
mutuals, and posts about my interests!! ive seen people request a dm option, but i dont mind how it is now. what i would love, however, is a trending page, and the ability to search words to find posts. overall, i do like it, but it needs some things added

title: Thoroughly enjoyable aside from one small problem
text: Am I the only one who has issues with video playback on this app? It‚Äôs on both versions of this app, not just iOS. Otherwise a solid substitute for Twitter! In these times it‚Äôs really important that you can get news and updates without triggering trolls.

title: Add several accounts
text: Hello I wish threads add this object: That we can add another Instagram account to this Because of several of us, use 2 or more accounts to Instagram and in this version we only add one account at all!! Please help us to make relationship with your application ü©∑

title: Needs more polish
text: I‚Äôm all for an alternative to twitter but this ain‚Äôt it yet. The UI lacks the polish that Twitter has and is just kinda clunky and unfinished in general. But to be fair I understand since it like just came out and is still being developed. My biggest issue with the UI is that the front page timeline thing isn‚Äôt very personalized and I‚Äôm getting a ton of stuff from people I don‚Äôt follow. I am looking forward to seeing this improve and be better

title: Instagram repackaged, irrelevant content
text: I stopped using Threads because Meta subscribed me to what I follow on instagram. On Twitter (I don‚Äôt care about its new name) I follow mostly hospitals and doctors and they upload clinical cases you have to answer, mnemonics, study material, etc. In instagram I follow footballers and clubs. Both services have very distinct uses for me. Meta was drowning on threads the things I want to see with basically repackaging what I see on instagram, and with a micro blog, I just don‚Äôt care about it.

title: Off to a good start
text: Threads has a lot of potential. It runs smoothly and is a much more enjoyable experience than its competition. The service continues to get better as they are new features, but more is needed. Hope they keep it up.

title: Severely lacking
text:
You would think a product from Meta (Facebook) would NOT be such a Beta build at launch. Especially considering there is no PC/Laptop/Mac counterpart. It's all mobile. There is no optimized for tablets version. Really only what amounts to a cellular version. I'll give it a pass for three small community. Yes, is just a Twitter/X clone, but there is no innovation. What. Some. Ever.
The ONLY reason it's get two (2) stars is that it easily converts you IG account over to Threads.

title: Best Community
text: Of all the social networking apps, Threads is the best! If you allow organic growth by following and being followed by people who share your interests, there is more content that is interesting than there is anywhere. I love this app. I love the community I‚Äôve built. Download Threads today!

title: This wasn‚Äôt made with marginalized communities in mind
text: Twitter was purposefully disconnected from your real identity. It was anonymous yet not. A way to get into the mind of everyone you knew. Instagram is LinkedIn for photos, and this app is designed to be used in the same way. There‚Äôs no NSFW content which immediately excludes SW‚Äôs and queer folk, which are part of the essential user base of twitter. Queer people are further prevented from getting involved with this app as it‚Äôs tied to your instagram and you can‚Äôt switch accounts. Finstas exist for a reason.

title: Can connect multiple accounts?
text: I‚Äôm only giving it two stars for right now because I‚Äôm still learning about it. You know how you can connect multiple accounts on Instagram and kind of switch back-and-forth without fully signing out‚Ä¶ Is there a way to do that with Threads? Like is there a way that I can also have Threads for my secondary/business account in the same way that we have them on Instagram?

title: Weird feed with no followed accounts
text: Very weird app if you join without following anyone. With the amount of data FB/IG has harvested from me over the past decade or more, you‚Äôd think they could populate my feed with semi-relevant posts. My feed was basically a left wing echo chamber that consisted of almost exclusively posts regarding X/Twitter/Elon Musk/Tesla and posts from Trans rights pages. I‚Äôve never expressed an interest in either topic. Pretty apparent what their motive is.

title: It‚Äôs cool
text: I think if you added a direct communication aspect it would be more interesting kind of like chat rooms or video lives that‚Äôs directed around the post or even the ability to leave voicemails about it would be cool think about it üíúüëÅüíúlove you instagram

title: Best social app and still improving
text: It was just a shell of an app at first, but now it is the best one on the market imo. New features are continually being rolled out and it seems to get better every month! Incredibly easy to cultivate a feed with your interests and preferred people.

title: It‚Äôs adequate
text:
Great start. It‚Äôs similar to Twitter in that it‚Äôs short form posts . I hope we can search threads by topic at some point. 

After interacting for a while I have started seeing accounts that interest me. The randomness of what can pop up while scrolling is nice too. 

It‚Äôs good vibes compared to similar apps , I hope it stays that way.

title: Better than twitter
text: Elon tried to force individuals to sign up to view a tweet. He wanted to force people to download and sign up. That is a ridiculous idea, I never cave but I‚Äôm all for threads taking over, no subscription model, not locked behind an account and better design.

title: I enjoy this app so far.
text: I love this app so far, it‚Äôs kind of like a cleaner version of twitter in my opinion. However I wish we could use hashtags.. I wish we could use hashtags and search them up and see other post with the hashtag. Like ‚Äú#Horrormovies‚Äù and see other post that has photos/words that they used the hashtag with.

title: So far it‚Äôs good!
text:
1. It‚Äôs super new so my timeline doesn‚Äôt have a lot of friends yet, but I would prefer a follower only tab in the future without any recommendations from other accounts.
- I suggest using the current format of the home page as the search tab (similar to instagram) 

2. I would also like a place to see who I‚Äôm currently following on this app. So far it only shows who follows me.

3. I have multiple accounts because of my personal and art account. There needs to be an easier way to switch between accounts. 

Overall it doesn‚Äôt need to be too different from Instagram!

title: Missing key features not as enjoyable
text: For a competitor of Twitter, it‚Äôs missing a couple of key things which I enjoyed from the site such as translations, filtering through who you‚Äôre following, and the atmosphere is simply just not the same as the site on Twitter. It feels too ‚Äúclean‚Äù. It promotes verified accounts on the algorithm way too much.

title: The potential is there but‚Ä¶
text: Please add a way to filter your feed to just people you follow. I will never use this app again if the only thing I ever see is recommended posts instead of creators I care about. Besides that it‚Äôs a great alternative to a certain dumpster fire of an app, I just hope they‚Äôll add more functionality!

title: Notifications bug
text:
To reproduce just go to profile turn on the notification after two minutes turn it off for particular profile. You still get notification. 

Btw the voice feature didn‚Äôt appear on new post screen.

title: Already becoming another Twitter cesspool
text: Barely started using it & already Threads is populating my feed with random hatemongers and bigots spewing their worthless two cents on my screen. Either the admins start really policing the hate speech & misinfo or I‚Äôm dumping this app. I don‚Äôt need Twitter clones further taking up my time to have to block and report and curate every other thing shoved in my face. Especially not from the very platform so heavily advertised as being the opposite of Elon Musk‚Äôs open sewer line of a platform.

title: instagram reels comments as an app
text: this app is a war zone and every time i scroll it‚Äôs a new battle. works functionally but it‚Äôs not really fun scrolling through a feed that consists of ONLY political arguments. like i‚Äôm not exaggerating i was scrolling for a good couple MINUTES and absolutely 0 content was anything other then politics and arguments about politics!!! it just not  fun to doomscroll on a platform that prioritizes a high algorithm over actual content, ontop of it having an absolutely awful community. truly a cesspool

title: Happy with Threads
text: Finally deleted TwitterX and glad to follow most of my favorites here. There is still work to do on this site. We would all like to see breaking news instead of many members who are looking for followers. Not my interest at all.

title: I like threads but‚Ä¶
text: I like threads but I don‚Äôt like being inundated with follow requests from porn bots every time I get on the app. I hate porn. It seems like the admins could do a better job of preventing this problem. There are decent people on this app. We‚Äôre faithful husbands and wives and we don‚Äôt want to be inundated by smut. So I would suggest the threads admins find a way to control and eliminate this problem.

title: Threads for iPad
text: Why is it that Meta doesn‚Äôt care to make Instagram and Threads compatible for iPad?! I‚Äôm sure you have the template with Facebook?! I mean, of all mobile devices iPad is the best for reading and typing, plus space on the side for all your ads! It so strenuous and unhealthy to read and type on a phone, iPad or tablet is the best device for that, yet for so many years you didn‚Äôt even bother to make it work on those. What a shame!

title: Ghost town
text: Is it just me or is this app completely dead? It had its 15 minutes of fame and now it‚Äôs just another advertising aggregator with no real way to reach your followers because the way the algorithm works on this app is a complete mystery. I don‚Äôt see anything from people I actually follow, just random celebrity posts and very cringe attempts at recreating twitter humor on Threads (which doesn‚Äôt even land because engagement doesn‚Äôt work the same way on Threads as it does on Twitter/*exhausted sigh* X üôÑüòí

title: Following friends
text: As soon as I downloaded the app I had the option to follow who I follow on insta and now I don‚Äôt have the opportunity, I‚Äôm hoping you can make a change I can go back and do that whenever. And on my home page I‚Äôd like the option to see those I‚Äôm following instead of verified and ads

title: love this app but I can‚Äôt find my friends
text: okay so when I first went on the app I clicked to make an account with my insta. it showed my most of my friends that have the app but I clicked off of it by mistake. now I have to manually follow each of my friends instead of having a easier way to find them

title: Please continue to be great to still photographers
text:
This is quickly blowing up for those who are looking to share creative work without the heavy marketing taken over on Instagram. Please please continue to be kind to us and create community again. 

Also please let me edit my posts.

title: Need way for nonInstagram users to sign up
text:
I hope to provide a better review in the future.

For those of us who joined Threads to get a Twitter alternative, we may not have an interest in Instagram itself. However, the Threads app does not provide a way to create an account ‚Äî only login to any existing one. That‚Äôs sort of unwelcoming and means that we would have to download Instagram to create an account, which seems like an unnecessary step.

title: Needs Translations
text: Correction: ‚ÄúRemoved two stars because why bother having a follow button if you see everyone on the app. Unless I‚Äôm an idiot, there‚Äôs nothing to allow you see only the people you follow.‚Äù The app has a lot of potential and is very clean, which I like a lot. Both reasons why it gets four stars, however I do follow a lot of artists that don‚Äôt speak English and without a translate option it‚Äôs impossible to interact.

title: NSFW Threads showing on Insta
text: While scrolling instagram, Threads posts from random accounts show up, I guess as ads or as ‚ÄúFor You‚Äù content. Anyway, it‚Äôs almost always NSFW stuff that‚Äôll get you in trouble with your significant other. Twerking, gym photos that are just about showing off curves, straight up Only Fans promos, etc. And if you click on it to try and mute or block the accounts, the algorithm just thinks you want to see more.

title: I'm still getting used to Threads.
text: Elon Musk should give up Twitter while he still can. While he's dictator of the site, I made Threads my personal safe space. I believe there's still hope for Twitter, but the only solution is simple. Kick Elon Musk out, take all his money, and make him rot in prison!

title: THREADS!
text:
In between Facebook and Instagram, there is Threads.
I am old, (so ALL of these App/Platforms/Thingies are new to me,)
But I‚Äôm trying‚Ä¶.
Threads seems to be a bit more political than I‚Äôd like, but then again, I don‚Äôt follow many others (yet).  Surprised at the people that I Do Know though‚Ä¶.modern technology, ya gotta love it!

title: Terrible feed
text:
I have to get through at least ten posts from accounts I don‚Äôt follow to get to a post from one that I do follow. Those other accounts aren‚Äôt even ones that I would follow, half of them are so disgusting that I end up blocking them. With how much money goes into meta products, you‚Äôd think they would have a decent algorithm.

UPDATE 
The app is almost completely overrun with porn. I report and block as much as I can, but it still doesn‚Äôt get removed.

title: Not bad, still needs work
text: It‚Äôs good but I wish there was a way to search for content I want to look at and not just usernames. It would make the app way easier to navigate and let me find content I‚Äôm actually interested in. The timeline is just full of stuff I don‚Äôt care about so I end up closing the app after thirty seconds of being on it.

title: Less toxic, room to grow
text: Honestly the less toxic environment is worth the migration.  It also makes me hesitant to suggest more typical social media features in hopes of maintaining that nice, neighborhood vibe.  Still, it would be great to have a way to discover similar people and form community.

title: Taylor Lorenz Lives Here ‚ò†Ô∏è

title: Good start but needs more features
text:
This app has been a good replacement for me as I have been dissatisfied with the changes happening at X, formerly known as Twitter. 

However, it is still missing some key features like hashtags, trending topics, search by topic and bookmarking. Hoping they get added in the future

title: Feels like 2015
text: this app is great! 5 stars from a person who personally does not rate apps nor likes insta as much as i did years ago. however threads feels like Twitter from like 2014 and 15 before it went wild. it's a nice feeling and i recommend downloading it for a nostalgia feel haha.

title: Functional, but lacking
text:
As a photographer, not having access to create posts from the desktop is crippling to sharing images that originated in the big camera.

The app ‚Äúfeed‚Äù seems to be lots of stuff I don‚Äôt care about from random people. I would like to see a chronological feed of posts from people I follow.

The app UI is clean but bland. More photos would help.

title: Promising start; feed needs some tweaking
text: A rather easy to use app, everything seems pretty intuitive. However, the feed layout is a bit weird. I want there to be a way to only see accounts you follow in addition to algorithm recommendations, and there needs to be a way to see the most recent Threads rather than just the top ones

title: Great Twitter Alternative
text: So happy we have a legitimate Twitter alternative now. Elon Musk ruined what was once a great app and is now just a white supremacist wasteland. Don‚Äôt have to worry about reading too many tweets with Threads. Was waiting for Bluesky but I‚Äôm going to stick with threads at this point. Bluesky playing too many games.

title: Already bummed about this app
text: It requires you use you Instagram account log in. What if you don‚Äôt want to? What if you want to keep it separate? What if you want to use your Facebook name? You have no choice. Why? Does Meta think they are the MCU? Why does everything have to be connected and why can‚Äôt we choose how we want to be connected if you don‚Äôt give us a choice?

title: I would not recommend this app.
text: This app was very annoying. #1, it‚Äôs literally just a knockoff twitter, #2, there were always too many notifications, and even after you open the app and check everything, the notification symbol would still be there! #3, this app was very confusing and difficult to operate, and #4, this type of stuff isn‚Äôt even entertaining!

title: Just about there, but lacking a slight Bit
text: It would make it a lot easier if we were able to save things we like. And also edit our posts or threads as you would say. Because we are not able to alter it do you have to make sure it‚Äôs right on.

title: Bugle ant cylinder Threads review wrench epoxy
text:
Magnet dodecahedron fish owl airplane.
Trumpet hammock beige crawdad corn.
There!  The first 10 words of this review are exactly like the Threads app.  Your feed will feature all kinds of worthless and unwanted posts.  Don't want to see posts from people you don't follow?  Too bad, because that's what Threads does.  Just be glad I didn't put *all* the words in this review in a random order... Threads will do it to you with no way to read posts in chronological order in your feed.
Blimp ovation neodymium turtle grapple.

title: Incomplete app
text: I regret making the account. Its a less than half baked app. Launching an app this hyped and lacking as many features as it does is laughable. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll get to it‚Äù isn‚Äôt acceptable to me. It has zero personality of its own other than being a busted twitter clone. It smells of being built in about a month under a crunch deadline and shipped out to the app stores to try and meet some kind of shareholders goal with the mentality of ‚Äúmake it better at some other point‚Äù at the forefront.
